intro: Verbesina sodiroi, commonly known as the Brazilian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Verbesina sodiroi is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
